WorkItem.Description:
I've started to use the DPSDK module of Rawr for my DK alt on the 2.3.1 version of Rawr and to change the rotation I had to go to the options pane and click on "Rotation Details".
 
I had a little break from the DK because i was focusing on my Main, but now i opened Rawr 2.3.8 and i cant find the rotation config, i saw that on 2.3.7 release notes the author wrote this: "- Rawr.DPSDK: Moved location of Rotation information to the options pane" ok but i don't have this info on my option tab and i can't find it anywhere else =|
 
I have attached a pic of my options pane, thx for the help.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request.DPSDK] Optimal Rotation is Not Displayed

Comments.Message: I believe he took the "choice" out in favor of a system that generates the optimal rotation for you instead.

ok if he generates the optimal rotation for me where can i find this info??? because i cant find any options to generate the rotation and my options tab shows nothing, even after running the optimizer ( if it has anything to do about it)

I second this. I personally preferred being able to set my own rotation, but could live with only being able to have it use auto-generated "optimal" rotations. However, for this to have any value at all it needs to at least have a way of displaying that optimized rotation to understand how it is calculating its numbers. As it is with the current version, there is no longer even a way to see what rotation is being used to come up with the theoretical dps numbers.
This would be OK, if the rotation was optimal. For my unholy build DPS is way too low compared to values i experience in raids.

Possibly related to this:

To start, My DPS says 3162.
I check "Refresh for significant change". (It still says 3162.)
I click 'Unholy': it jumps to 3486.
I click back on 'Blood': it now says 4145. I've just gained nearly 1k dps by changing nothing.
I uncheck "Refresh for significant change": it immediately drops back to 3162.

If I keep 'Refresh for...' unchecked through the presence change, then check it at the end, it's the same story.

Attached - Seraphel DPS.xml
Yeah, when all of the "refresh for..." options are checked, it re-calculates the rotation for every pass of every change.  That's why it's taking so long.
Making this a feature request for Rawr4.  Make sure that I provide a mechanism to at least display the rotation used for calcs.
